bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, July 3, 1875

div1.p: Reed informs the Adjutant General about his appointment as Assistant Surgeon. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, July 3, 1875
div1.p:
Accepts appointment as
such, age 23 years 13th
Sept. '74, born in Gloucester Co.
Va and has been a permanent
resident of Va.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Adjutant General, July 3, 1875
div1.opener:
Murfreesboro,
North Carolina.
July 3rd, '75.
To
The Adjutant General, U.S. Army,
Washington, D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to inform you that
on the 2nd day of July, I received from
the Hon. Secretary of War my appointment
as Assistant Surgeon, U.S. Army, and
I do, hereby, respectfully accept the same.
I, also, have the honor to return the oath
of office, required of me, properly filled
up, subscribed and attested, and would
respectfully state that I was twenty-three
(23) years of age, Septr 13th 1874; that I was
born in Gloucester County, Va., and
that I have been a permanent resi-
dent of the state of Va.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Adjutant General, July 3, 1875
div1.opener:
Murfreesboro,
North Carolina,
July 3rd, 1875.
To
The Surgeon General, U.S.A.
Washington, D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
Having, on the 2nd day of July, received
from the Hon. Secretary of War my
appointment as Ass't. Surgeon, U.S.A.
together with a notification to “report for
duty, by letter, to the Surgeon General, U.S.A.
Washington, D.C.,” I have the honor to
inform you that, from this date, I
hold myself in readiness to receive orders.

I would, furthermore, respectfully
add that, as circumstances compelled
me to visit my father, at this place, (Mur-
freesboro, N.C.) my orders be forwarded
to this point, instead of Harrisonburg, Va.
